private_information: I can move the top disk from one peg to another peg.
I must move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, its relative size ordering with the others is preserved.
mover.goal: Move the stack of seven disks from the middle peg to the right peg preserving order so that right peg from top to bottom is A B C D E F G and both left and middle pegs are empty.

private_information: I check temporal and causal consistency of move sequences.
I detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as token quotas, invented intermediate states, or post-hoc penalties.
I ensure each move is valid under the rules and that no illicit assumptions are made about concurrent moves.
auditor.goal: Audit any proposed move sequence or plan, remove shortcuts and produce a causally and temporally consistent validated plan for moving the seven disks.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate analysis and audit results and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that solves the seven-disk Tower of Hanoi instance with pegs left middle right and disks A B C D E F G.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are seven disks named A B C D E F G ordered from smallest (A) to largest (G).
Initial configuration: the middle peg holds from top to bottom A B C D E F G. The left and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: the right peg must hold from top to bottom A B C D E F G and both left and middle pegs must be empty.
Valid action: move the top disk from one peg to another peg.
Rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; only the top disk of a peg may be moved; a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
The left peg may be used as an intermediate parking spot but must be empty at the end.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent that enumerates high level move sequences for the Tower of Hanoi instance. Do not emit PDDL. Produce an explicit, ordered sequence of legal moves using the disk names and peg names provided in the environment. Explain any assumptions you relied on and list any points where additional coordination or verification would be needed.
analysis.prompt: Your name is mover. Use the public information available in the environment and your private knowledge about allowed moves and constraints. Provide a clear ordered list of moves that would transfer the seven-disk stack from middle to right using left as intermediate when needed. Do not produce PDDL. If you cannot produce a full sequence, produce as large a prefix as you can without making unwarranted assumptions.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor agent focused on temporal and causal consistency. You remove bookkeeping shortcuts and ensure the plan is free of implicit assumptions about concurrency or invented tokens. You must not produce PDDL. Instead, produce a validated move sequence and a short report enumerating any corrections or removed shortcuts and the invariants you verified.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You receive the mover's proposed move sequence and must check every move for legality against the public rules. If the mover proposed any shortcut or assumption that bypasses the rules, remove it and produce a corrected sequence. Produce also an audit report that lists invariants checked such as single-disk move, top-disk constraint, and the disk size ordering constraint.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in creating multi-agent PDDL models and problems for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the analysis and the auditor's report and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance with seven disks and three pegs. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain must include a move action with preconditions enforcing top-of-peg and size ordering, and effects that update top-of-peg and disk-on relationships. The problem must declare objects for disks A B C D E F G and pegs left middle right, set the initial stack on middle, and set the goal stack on right. Ensure the domain and problem are suitable for FastDownwards and avoid using shortcuts that rely on external bookkeeping mechanisms.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate the public information about the environment, the mover analysis, and the auditor report. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards that implement the legal move action and the seven-disk instance. Keep actions explicit and avoid encoding any implicit tokens or shortcuts. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
